docs.abstract: Minutes from the Federal Reserve’s July 27-28 meeting showed that “most” officials “judged that the standard set out in the committee’s guidance regarding asset purchases could be reached this year.”
docs.snippet: Minutes from the Federal Reserve’s July 27-28 meeting showed that “most” officials “judged that the standard set out in the committee’s guidance regarding asset purchases could be reached this year.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials are preparing to slow the central bank’s large purchases of government-backed bonds, the first step toward a more normal monetary policy setting as the economy heals from the pandemic — but when they met last month, they remained starkly divided over just when the pullback should happen.
